extendedIngredients.name: lemon grass
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons thinly sliced peeled fresh lemon grass (about 1 stalk) or 1 tablespoon grated lemon peel
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced peeled fresh lemon grass (about 1 stalk) or 1 tablespoon grated lemon peel

extendedIngredients.name: thai chili
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 teaspoon Thai chili paste (such as Dynasty)

title: Malaysian Lime-Coconut Swordfish
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free main course? Malaysian Lime-Coconut Swordfish could be an amazing recipe to try. For $4.62 per serving, this recipe covers 19% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. One serving contains 397 calories, 35g of protein, and 25g of fat. If you have lemon grass, coconut milk, thai chili paste, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 56%, this dish is good. Similar recipes are Grilled Swordfish Skewers with Coconut, Key Lime and Green Chile Sauce, Just The Recipe Please For Malaysian Coconut Prawns With Cognac, and Malaysian Coconut Milk Rice (Nasi Lemak).

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Loveblock Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Loveblock Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Loveblock Pinot Gris is a pale golden with hints of green. The 2013 vintage is a dry style with floral aromas and a hint of ripe pineapple. The palate reveals poached pear and blood orange, and finishes with a touch of citrus, good texture and rich mouth feel.

instructions: Preheat broiler.                                                                                                Combine first 9 ingredients in a food processor; pulse 3 times or until coarsely chopped. Place fish on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray; spread 1/2 cup shallot mixture evenly over fish. Broil 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve the fish with the remaining shallot mixture, and garnish with cilantro sprigs and lemon wedges, if desired.

steps.step: Combine first 9 ingredients in a food processor; pulse 3 times or until coarsely chopped.
Place fish on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray; spread 1/2 cup shallot mixture evenly over fish. Broil 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
Serve the fish with the remaining shallot mixture, and garnish with cilantro sprigs and lemon wedges, if desired.
